title.narrative: Three research centres at KU LIFE

description.narrative: In 2008 a grant agreement was entered between the Faculty of Life Sciences (KU-LIFE) at University of Copenhagen and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs covering a three year period and with a total budget of DKK 89 million. The purpose of the grant was to fund activities at the thee centres at LIFE, i.e. Danish Centre for Forest, Landscape and Planning (FLD), Danish Seed Health Centre for Developing Countries (DSHC), and Centre for Health Research and Development (DBL). The three centres provide an important and internationally recognized contribution to knowledge generation, capacity building, and use of research based knowledge for development. During the contract period, the three centres will contribute to the establishment of thematic platforms under the auspices of ¿Universities Denmark¿s¿ initiative Building Stronger Universities in Developing Countries. The initiative and platforms will contribute to the strengthening of human and institutional capacities of partner institutions, and also contribute to the achievement of the objectives and outputs of the platforms.
